docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 8 -- The Soviet Union and five of its satellite states endorsed today a resolution calling upon members of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization "to assure freedom of expression and to remove...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 8 -- The Soviet Union and five of its satellite states endorsed today a resolution calling upon members of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization "to assure freedom of expression and to remove barriers to the free flow of undistorted information."
docs.abstract: USSR bloc joins in backing resolution on free news flow; US states objection to proviso that news be 'undistorted'; USSR yields on war propaganda stand

headline.main: FREEDOM OF NEWS URGED BY UNESCO; Soviet Bloc Joins in Backing Declaration -- U. S. Deplores Proviso on 'Distortion'

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 9 (UP) -- The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization voted today to expand its activities in all fields and to double its present budget to more than $20,000,000.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 9 (UP) -- The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization voted today to expand its activities in all fields and to double its present budget to more than $20,000,000.

docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 10 -- Dr. Luther Evans, director general of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization, announced tonight he had taken direct action on seven of the eight employes whose dismissal the United States sought on loyalty grounds.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 11 -- Dr. Arcot L. Mudaliar, vice chancellor of Madras University of India, was elected chairman of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization's executive board today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 11 -- Dr. Arcot L. Mudaliar, vice chancellor of Madras University of India, was elected chairman of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization's executive board today.
docs.abstract: Dr Mudaliar (India) elected bd chmn, Drs Veronese (Italy) and Secco Ellauri (Uruguay) vice chmn

docs.snippet: UNTIL recently travelers who had to keep an eye on their expenses automatically ruled South America out of bounds. For one thing, the cost of transportation alone put such a holiday out of the realm of possibility.

docs.snippet: British sterling moved irregularly last week. After a firm start which saw the pound held around the $2.79 level, lower London cables later partially canceled the earlier improvement.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 15 -- A resolution blocking action on the Cyprus question at this session of the United Nations General Assembly was approved today by a key committee.
